FuncDef: The clear master-key command deletes historical system master key. The clear master-key command deletes historical system master key.
Examples: Warning: This operation will delete all historical master keys. Are you sure you want to perform it? [Y/N]:y
ExtraInfo: In an actual network environment, the network and devices are provided and maintained by network providers, and the data belongs to tenants. To provide secure data transmission and storage on the network, ensure that keys are under complete control of the specific tenant and cannot be obtained by network providers or other tenants. To be specific, tenants need to have their own key management schemes. Tenants can manually clear historical system master keys based on actual requirements to enhance data security and reliability.
